body: What version of GLFW are you using?
I install it by  pip install glfw. and I am using python3.5. I am not sure about the version.
What does `glfwGetVersionString` return?
What do you mean by glfwGetVersionString? it is not a bash command or a python command? How I use it?

It's a GLFW function.

I don't know what they named that function in your Python binding, but it should be in there if it's a complete binding.
The reason I'm asking is that it sounds like one of several bugs that were fixed a while ago.

I believe it is glfw 3? Because I notice it is calling this "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libglfw.so.3.0'"
And on the python website: "https://pypi.python.org/pypi/glfw/1.4.0 " it is saying it is wrapper for glfw3
(3, 0, 4) , it is the output of glfw.get_version()

Thank you. That looks very plausible.

That version of GLFW was released in 2013 and many bugs have been fixed since, most likely including this one. Try upgrading to a newer version.

Oh, that's really good. ehhhh, but I still have a problem. 
I have used "git clone, cmake, cmake make make install" 
I only got a libglfw3.a, but I think I may need a .so file for the python interface. So may you tell me which part of your cmakelist should I change?

well~, I think my situation is getting more complicated.  When I am testing the test file in glfw/test.
I got "Segmentation fault (core dumped)" for every test program.
The glfwinfo runs out:
```
GLFW header version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version string: "3.3.0 X11 GLX EGL clock_gettime /dev/js"
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
So what the probelm might be???

> I only got a libglfw3.a, but I think I may need a .so file for the python interface. So may you tell me which part of your cmakelist should I change?

You don't need to change that file. Run `cmake -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=1 .` instead of `cmake .` to [build the shared library](http://www.glfw.org/docs/latest/compile_guide.html#compile_options).

> So what the probelm might be???

I can't tell without more information. Try running it in a debugger (gdb or lldb) and see where the crash occurs.

```sh
cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug .
gdb tests/glfwinfo
run
bt
```

The compile option is very useful, so the first problem is solved. I ran the glfw in a debug mode as your instruction.
And here is the output:
```
(ENV3.5) exx@exx:~/glfw$ gdb tests/glfwinfo
GNU gdb (Ubuntu 7.7.1-0ubuntu5~14.04.2) 7.7.1

Type "apropos word" to search for commands related to "word"...

(gdb) run
Starting program: /home/exx/glfw/tests/glfwinfo
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
GLFW header version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version string: "3.3.0 X11 GLX EGL clock_gettime /dev/js shared"

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff7bab80d in chooseGLXFBConfig () from /home/exx/glfw/src/libglfw.so.3
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff7bab80d in chooseGLXFBConfig () from /home/exx/glfw/src/libglfw.so.3
#1  0x00007ffff7bad035 in _glfwChooseVisualGLX () from /home/exx/glfw/src/libglfw.so.3
#2  0x00007ffff7ba896d in _glfwPlatformCreateWindow () from /home/exx/glfw/src/libglfw.so.3
#3  0x00007ffff7b9edc2 in glfwCreateWindow () from /home/exx/glfw/src/libglfw.so.3
#4  0x000000000040bcc9 in main ()
(gdb)
```
So what the problem might be?

Sorry, don't know yet. You did everything perfectly but I forgot a step (so we didn't get frame information or line numbers).
```
cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug .
make clean all
gdb tests/glfwinfo
run
bt
```

Ok, that's fine. Is it enough for this time?

That's perfect. Thank you!

...I have no idea how that would fail, though. Looking into it.
That will be helpful. I have been in trouble with it for a while.

If you change line 67 of `src/glx_context.c` from
```c
    if (!nativeCount)
```
to
```c
    if (!nativeConfigs || !nativeCount)
```
does that affect anything?

The error changes into:
```
(gdb) runStarting program: /home/exx/glfw/tests/glfwinfo
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
GLFW header version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version: 3.3.0
GLFW library version string: "3.3.0 X11 GLX EGL clock_gettime /dev/js shared"
Error: GLX: No GLXFBConfigs returned
Error: GLX: Failed to find a suitable GLXFBConfig
[Inferior 1 (process 2865) exited with code 01]
(gdb) bt
No stack.
(gdb)
```
So the good news is we found an easily fixed bug in GLFW. The bad news is your machine appears not to have OpenGL support.
